questions.question: If you see pedestrians or children near the road, you should:
choices: Slow down and be prepared to stop
Turn on your headlights
Honk your horn

questions.question: You should not attempt to pass another vehicle:
choices: On a road with center lines
At a railroad crossing
When it is dark

questions.question: What is the first thing you should do when your car starts to skid?
choices: Take your foot off the gas pedal
Turn your steering wheel in the opposite direction of the skid
Steer straight ahead

questions.question: If bad weather makes it hard for you to see ahead, you should:
choices: Increase your following distance
Speed up to get off the road quickly
Drive in the lane closest to oncoming traffic

questions.question: When stopped by a police vehicle:
choices: Exit and place hands on top of your vehicle
Have your license ready before the officer approaches
Stay inside your vehicle

questions.question: An infant under one year or under 20 lbs. must always be secured in:
choices: A rear-facing car seat
In the lap of an adult
A forward-facing car seat

questions.question: The driver ahead signals:
choices: A left turn
A right turn
A slow down or stop

questions.question: Which is true about large trucks?
choices: They need less room to maneuver
Blind spots are eliminated by large mirrors
They take longer to stop

questions.question: If a traffic signal light is not working, you:
choices: May proceed without stopping
Must always stop
Have the right of way

questions.question: You must always stop before a railroad crossing, if:
choices: You have young children in the car
There is not enough room for your vehicle on the other side
The crossing is marked with only a crossbuck sign

questions.question: This sign means:
choices: Side Road
Lane reduction ahead
Left or straight only

questions.question: What should you do when you see this sign?
choices: Merge right
Merge left
Stop

questions.question: If you are involved in a highway accident you must always:
choices: Warn other traffic by standing behind your vehicle
Immediately move injured people off the roadway
Stop at the scene

questions.question: Taking a cold shower after drinking alcohol:
choices: Helps you to sober up more quickly
Cancels the effect of the alcohol
Has no effect on alcohol concentration in your body

questions.question: If you are having trouble remembering the last few miles, it is most likely a sign of:
choices: Night blindness
Drowsy driving
Defensive driving

questions.question: If you approach a stopped school bus with flashing red lights on this roadway, you must:
choices: Always stop
Slow down and pass carefully
Stop only when traveling in the same direction as the bus

questions.question: Which road signs have this eight-sided shape?
choices: Yield signs
Direction guidance signs
Stop signs

questions.question: What parts of a road might hold frost and ice while the rest is dry?
choices: Curvy roads
Bridges
Intersections

questions.question: When can you park on the roadside of another parked vehicle (double parking)?
choices: If you are not obstructing the view or interfering with traffic
If you park for less than five minutes
Under no circumstances

questions.question: The road edge on the right side is marked by a:
choices: Solid white line
Broken white line
Solid yellow line

questions.question: If a school bus with flashing red lights has stopped on your side of an undivided highway with four lanes, you must:
choices: Slow down and proceed with caution
Stop
Pass as quickly as possible

questions.question: When may you legally drive around a lowered gate at a railroad crossing?
choices: When the warning lights are not flashing
When you can see clearly in all directions
Under no circumstances

questions.question: Parking your car in front of a driveway is:
choices: Never allowed
Allowed, if the driveway is private
Allowed, if the driveway is not frequently used

questions.question: You must use your headlights:
choices: One-half hour after sunset until one-half hour before sunrise
One-half hour before sunset until one-half hour before sunrise
One-half hour before sunset until one-half hour after sunrise

questions.question: This sign means:
choices: Traffic in the right lane must turn right
Traffic in left lane must continue driving straight
Traffic in both lanes must turn right

questions.question: When going straight ahead in a two-lane roundabout with no signs or markings, you should:
choices: Enter in any lane
Always enter in the left lane
Always enter in the right lane

questions.question: What is the best thing to do if you become tired while driving?
choices: Open all windows
Turn on the radio
Stop at a safe place and rest

questions.question: Before making a right turn:
choices: Signal for 20-30 feet before the turn
Swing your vehicle wide to the left
Search the intersection in all the directions

questions.question: The four-second method helps a driver determine:
choices: How closely to follow another vehicle
How much time it takes to pass
When to turn on headlights

questions.question: If you approach a stopped emergency vehicle with activated warning lights on a two-lane highway, you must:
choices: Move over to the left half of the roadway
Slow down and pass with caution
Stop at least 200 feet behind the emergency vehicle

questions.question: If your lane ends ahead and there is a large truck in the lane beside you, you should:
choices: Slow down and merge behind the truck
Speed up and merge in front of the truck
Stay alongside the truck and assume that the truck will slow down

questions.question: When you drive through a construction zone, you should:
choices: Be prepared to slow down or stop
Slow down to watch the ongoing work
Decrease distance between you and any car ahead

questions.question: On a road with yellow center lines:
choices: Traffic flows in two (opposite) directions
Crossing the yellow lines is prohibited
Traffic flows in one direction only

questions.question: What will help a driver stay seated and in control of the vehicle in a crash?
choices: Safety belts
Airbags
Draping the right arm across the seat

questions.question: The Implied Consent Law means:
choices: If arrested for DUI, you must submit to a test
You must always carry proper insurance
You must take special precautions to avoid accidents

questions.question: It is illegal to park a vehicle if a traffic light is within:
choices: 50 feet
30 feet
40 feet

questions.question: If you have difficulty focusing or keeping your eyes open while driving, you should:
choices: Drive faster and avoid distractions
Stop and rest
Keep your eyes still and play loud music

questions.question: This flagger signal means:
choices: Proceed
Stop
Slow

questions.question: Which statement is true about motorcyclists and motorists?
choices: They have the same rights and responsibilities as other drivers
They are easier to see in traffic
They are less affected by wind and rain

questions.question: Who should have the right-of-way at a roundabout?
choices: A driver already in the roundabout
Any driver approaching from the right
A driver entering the roundabout

questions.question: When you are in a line of traffic at a railroad crossing that has no signals or gates:
choices: Go across only when there is enough room for your vehicle on the other side
When crossing the tracks, you may pass slower vehicles
You have the right of way and do not need to check for trains

questions.question: What do the light gray areas in this picture show?
choices: Areas covered by your mirrors
Vehicle maneuver angles
Blind spots

questions.question: Night driving is more dangerous than daytime driving because:
choices: Drivers tend to be more alert at night
It is harder to see at night
There is less traffic at night

questions.question: Which color are road signs that indicate you safely drive through a work zone?
choices: Red
Orange
Yellow

questions.question: This sign means:
choices: Divided highway ends
One lane ends
A road crosses the main highway

questions.question: When backing up or reversing your car:
choices: Depend on your mirrors
Turn your head and look mostly through the rear window
Look over your left shoulder

questions.question: A red arrow on a traffic light means:
choices: You may turn in that direction after a full stop
You cannot turn in that direction
You may turn in that direction

questions.question: On a two-lane road, passing on the right of a vehicle is only allowed if:
choices: The other vehicle is signaling a left turn
Passing on the left is prohibited
You use the shoulder

questions.question: When a school bus displays flashing yellow lights near the top of the bus:
choices: You should try to pass as quickly as possible
The bus is about to stop
You must come to an immediate stop

questions.question: Text messaging while driving is:
choices: Prohibited for all drivers
Only prohibited in emergency situations
Only prohibited for drivers under 18 years

questions.question: Drinking coffee after drinking alcohol:
choices: Cancels the effect of the alcohol
Has no effect on alcohol concentration in your body
Helps you to sober up more quickly

questions.question: Proof of financial responsibility is needed:
choices: Whenever you drive
When applying for a driver's license
Only when asked for by a law enforcement officer
